intro: Sphaeralcea crenulata, commonly known as the coast buckthorn, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round, reddish-brown fruits that are often used by birds and small mammals. Sphaeralcea crenulata thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal climates with salt spray. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
